posts.title: Getting Started with Next.js
posts.content: Next.js is a powerful React framework that enables server-side rendering, static site generation, and API routes. This guide helps beginners understand the basics and set up their first project step by step.

posts.title: Understanding React Hooks
posts.content: React Hooks allow you to use state and other React features without writing a class. Hooks like useState, useEffect, and useContext simplify logic and improve code readability.

posts.title: Dark Mode in Modern Web Apps
posts.content: Dark mode has become a standard feature in modern applications. This article explains how to implement dark mode using CSS variables, prefers-color-scheme, and JavaScript toggles.

posts.title: Optimizing Web Performance
posts.content: Performance optimization improves user experience and SEO. Learn about code splitting, lazy loading, image optimization, and best practices to make your website blazing fast.

posts.title: JavaScript ES6 Features You Should Know
posts.content: ES6 introduced powerful features like arrow functions, destructuring, template literals, and modules. These features make JavaScript cleaner, more expressive, and easier to maintain.

posts.title: Building Responsive Layouts with CSS Grid
posts.content: CSS Grid is a two-dimensional layout system that makes building responsive designs simple. This guide walks through grid concepts, examples, and real-world layout patterns.

posts.title: API Integration Basics for Frontend Developers
posts.content: APIs allow frontend applications to communicate with servers. Learn how to fetch data using REST APIs, handle errors, and manage loading states effectively.

posts.title: Deploying Your App to Production
posts.content: Deployment is the final step in building an application. This article covers deployment strategies, environment variables, and tips for deploying apps smoothly to production.aaaaaaaaaaa
